content:
To create a detailed description of a new smartphone in HTML format using the provided data, you can use JavaScript to dynamically generate the HTML content. Below is a JavaScript code snippet that constructs an HTML representation of the smartphone's specifications: ```javascript // Define the smartphone specifications var brand = "Samsung"; var model = "Galaxy S21"; var screenSize = "6.2 inches"; var resolution = "1080 x 2400 pixels"; var processor = "Exynos 2100"; var RAM = "8 GB"; var storage = "128 GB"; var batteryCapacity = "4000 mAh"; var camera = "Triple Camera (12 MP + 64 MP + 12 MP)"; var OS = "Android 11"; var connectivity = "5G, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 5.2, NFC"; // Create a function to generate the HTML content function generateSmartphoneDescription() { var htmlContent = `

Smartphone Specifications

Brand: ${brand}
Model: ${model}
Screen Size: ${screenSize}
Resolution: ${resolution}
Processor: ${processor}
RAM: ${RAM}
Storage: ${storage}
Battery Capacity: ${batteryCapacity}
Camera: ${camera}
Operating System: ${OS}
Connectivity: ${connectivity}
`; return htmlContent; } // Insert the generated HTML into the document document.body.innerHTML = generateSmartphoneDescription(); ``` This JavaScript code creates a structured HTML table displaying the smartphone's specifications. The table is styled with basic CSS for a clean and organized look. You can insert this JavaScript code into an HTML document, and it will dynamically generate the smartphone description within the webpage.
